title: PHV Driver’s Licence - Legal Responsibilities, Safety, and Customer Service

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if they lose their ID badge?
options: Continue working until a replacement arrives
Report it to TfL immediately and request a replacement
Only inform their operator
Wait until licence renewal to get a new one
questions.answer: Report it to TfL immediately and request a replacement

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of a PHV driver?
options: Following traffic laws
Keeping their vehicle roadworthy
Offering personal opinions on social issues
Providing a professional and polite service
questions.answer: Offering personal opinions on social issues

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they feel drowsy while driving?
options: Reduce speed but keep driving
Take a break and rest
Drink coffee and continue
Ignore the fatigue and complete the journey
questions.answer: Take a break and rest

questions.question: What is the best way for a PHV driver to handle a passenger who becomes aggressive?
options: Engage in an argument
Remain calm, avoid confrontation, and report it if necessary
Ignore the passenger
Drop them off immediately, regardless of location
questions.answer: Remain calm, avoid confrontation, and report it if necessary

questions.question: Which of the following must be reported to TfL?
options: A change in residential address
A minor delay due to traffic
A disagreement with a passenger
A car wash appointment
questions.answer: A change in residential address

questions.question: Which of the following is a safeguarding responsibility for PHV drivers?
options: Ignoring suspicious behavior
Taking photos of passengers for security
Discussing passenger details with other drivers
Reporting concerns to the appropriate authorities
questions.answer: Reporting concerns to the appropriate authorities

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if a passenger requests a route change?
options: Only allow changes for short distances
Ignore the request and follow the original route
Assess safety and legality before agreeing to the change
Refuse the request
questions.answer: Assess safety and legality before agreeing to the change

questions.question: Which document must be displayed in a PHV vehicle?
options: A list of fare charges
The driver’s licence disc
A personal driving record
A certificate of insurance
questions.answer: The driver’s licence disc

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if they witness an accident while driving?
options: Ignore it and continue the journey
Report it to the emergency services if necessary
Only stop if passengers insist
Call their operator first before deciding
questions.answer: Report it to the emergency services if necessary

questions.question: Which insurance is required for PHV vehicles?
options: Fire and theft insurance
Hire or reward insurance
Comprehensive insurance
Personal accident insurance
questions.answer: Hire or reward insurance

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if a passenger leaves an item in the vehicle?
options: Keep it and wait for the passenger to contact them
Report it to the operator or local police
Ignore it and continue working
Sell it after 24 hours
questions.answer: Report it to the operator or local police

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do before accepting a fare?
options: Confirm the booking through an operator
Ask for payment in advance
Request personal details from the passenger
Negotiate the fare
questions.answer: Confirm the booking through an operator

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if their vehicle is involved in an accident?
options: Report it to the operator and authorities
Continue driving if no damage is visible
Fix it themselves later
Ignore it if the passenger does not complain
questions.answer: Report it to the operator and authorities

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if they receive a police request while on duty?
options: Only respond if carrying no passengers
Ignore it if not at fault
Comply with the request immediately
Wait until their shift ends to respond
questions.answer: Comply with the request immediately

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if they suspect human trafficking?
options: Report it to the police or relevant authorities
Ask the passenger directly
Ignore it unless certain
Discuss it with other drivers
questions.answer: Report it to the police or relevant authorities

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do when picking up a pre-booked passenger?
options: Confirm the passenger’s identity before starting the journey
Ask for cash payment before driving
Only ask for the destination
Begin driving without verification
questions.answer: Confirm the passenger’s identity before starting the journey

questions.question: How should a PHV driver respond if a passenger refuses to pay?
options: Take the passenger directly to the police station
Politely request payment and report it to the operator if necessary
Refuse to let the passenger leave the vehicle
Threaten legal action immediately
questions.answer: Politely request payment and report it to the operator if necessary

questions.question: TfL expects all licensed drivers to offer Londoners and visitors a professional and safe service. Providing excellent customer service is an important part of being a London PHV driver.
options: TfL expects all licensed drivers to offer Londoners water
TfL expects all licensed drivers to offer Londoners and visitors a professional and safe service
TfL expects all licensed drivers to offer refreshments
questions.answer: TfL expects all licensed drivers to offer Londoners and visitors a professional and safe service

questions.question: Do operators need to keep details of complaints made to them?
options: Yes, details of all complaints
Yes, but only details of complaints involving violent or aggressive behaviour
No
questions.answer: Yes, details of all complaints

questions.question: Operators must report the following types of complaints to the police:
options: Operators are not required to notify the police about any type of complaints
They must report all complaints to the police
Any complaints that involve possible crimes
questions.answer: Any complaints that involve possible crimes

questions.question: A passenger might report any complaints to:
options: Your operator or the police or TfL directly
Only to your operator
Only to TfL
questions.answer: Your operator or the police or TfL directly

questions.question: If your passenger is seriously ill, you should call the emergency services on 999 immediately. You should not try to physically check the passenger or administer first aid yourself unless you are following the instructions of the emergency services or a medical professional, or you have had appropriate first aid or medical training.
options: If you have first aid training, try to check the passenger physically or provide first aid yourself
You should not try to physically check the passenger or administer first aid yourself unless you are following the instructions of the emergency services or a medical professional
Remove the passenger from your vehicle then call the emergency services 999 immediately
questions.answer: You should not try to physically check the passenger or administer first aid yourself unless you are following the instructions of the emergency services or a medical professional

questions.question: What may happen if a serious complaint is made against you or there are multiple complaints or a pattern of poor behavior?
options: TfL will report you to the DVLA and your driving licence may be revoked
TfL may have to suspend or revoke your licence
TfL has no powers to take any action
questions.answer: TfL may have to suspend or revoke your licence

questions.question: Can you use a passenger's contact details to start communicating with them about anything other than the booked journey?
options: No, it's unacceptable
Yes, but only within 48 hours from completing the journey
Yes, but only within 72 hours from completing the journey
questions.answer: No, it's unacceptable

questions.question: Passengers might also contact TfL if they are not satisfied with the way the operator has dealt with their complaint.
options: If passengers are dissatisfied with a driver's behavior, they should not notify TfL
They might also contact TfL if they are not satisfied with the way the operator has dealt with their complaint
Once the operator receives the complaint, TfL will not become involved
questions.answer: They might also contact TfL if they are not satisfied with the way the operator has dealt with their complaint

questions.question: TfL expects all licensed drivers to offer Londoners and visitors:
options: Bottled water
Professional and safe service
Free rides
questions.answer: Professional and safe service

questions.question: How does TfL deal with complaints that relate to you?
options: TfL may carry out its own investigation
TfL may ask for your comments
TfL will suspend your licence immediately until the complaint is resolved
questions.answer: TfL may carry out its own investigation

questions.question: You as a PHV driver have the responsibility to?
options: Make sure that your air-conditioning is ON
Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle
Know all routes in central London
questions.answer: Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle

questions.question: If your passenger is ill, or has a disability, and asks you to help them enter or leave your vehicle, what should you do?
options: Refuse and contact the emergency services
Make sure you check exactly what help they are asking you for
Do nothing and continue driving
questions.answer: Make sure you check exactly what help they are asking you for

questions.question: You should never make comments or jokes about someone's:
options: Football team, political views
Age, race, religion
Disability, sexual orientation or gender identity
questions.answer: Disability, sexual orientation or gender identity

questions.question: Can you get into the back seat of your vehicle while you have passengers on board?
options: Yes, it's your vehicle
No, unless it's an emergency
Yes, but only between 6am and 10pm
questions.answer: No, unless it's an emergency

questions.question: If TfL does investigate a complaint that relates to you, what will happen?
options: TfL cannot decide based on the information received
TfL will provide you with the details of the complaint and ask for your comments
TfL will suspend your licence immediately until the complaint is resolved
questions.answer: TfL will provide you with the details of the complaint and ask for your comments

questions.question: If your passenger is seriously ill, what should you do?
options: Call the emergency services on 999 immediately and follow their instructions
Physically check the passenger and move them out of the vehicle as quickly as possible
Continue driving and wait to see if their condition worsens
questions.answer: Call the emergency services on 999 immediately and follow their instructions

questions.question: Sexual behaviour between you and a passenger is?
options: Only acceptable if you both agree to it
Only acceptable if you both agree to it and it takes place after completion of the journey
Not acceptable even if you both agree to it
questions.answer: Not acceptable even if you both agree to it

questions.question: If you are found to have acted in an unsuitable way towards a passenger?
options: You will receive a warning
You will lose your licence
No action will be taken
questions.answer: You will lose your licence

questions.question: Avoid any behaviour that might be understood as?
options: Being sexual
Being friendly
Being worried
questions.answer: Being sexual

questions.question: The way that you interact with passengers will affect the way they feel about their journey with you.
options: You can use a passenger's contact details to start communicating with them about anything other than the booked journey
The way that you interact with them will affect the way they will feel about their journey with you.
You can make comments or jokes about someone
questions.answer: The way that you interact with them will affect the way they will feel about their journey with you.

questions.question: You should never?
options: Assist your passenger when asked to
Touch a passenger in an unacceptable way or suggest having sex with a passenger
Engage in conversation of a sexual nature. This includes asking questions about someone’s sex life or telling sexual jokes
questions.answer: Engage in conversation of a sexual nature. This includes asking questions about someone’s sex life or telling sexual jokes

questions.question: You should never?
options: Look at or speak to a passenger in a way that makes them feel uncomfortable, for example staring at any part of their body
Make any political or football-related comments
Make any sexual remarks or comments about a passenger’s appearance or clothing
questions.answer: Make any sexual remarks or comments about a passenger’s appearance or clothing

questions.question: Contacting a passenger for personal or social reasons is?
options: Acceptable
Unacceptable
Permitted under TfL guidelines
questions.answer: Unacceptable

questions.question: You should never?
options: Offer a bottle of water to a passenger
Offer or accept sex or sexual activity in place of a fare
Take part in sexual activity of any kind with a passenger (even if both you and the passenger agree to it or the passenger suggests it)
questions.answer: Take part in sexual activity of any kind with a passenger (even if both you and the passenger agree to it or the passenger suggests it)

questions.question: You should never?
options: Watch, display, or share pornographic or sexual pictures, or any other sexual material
Watch Netflix while waiting for a booking
Commit any other sexual offence
questions.answer: Commit any other sexual offence

questions.question: You must not enter the back seat of the vehicle with passengers inside unless it's an emergency.
options: You must not enter the back seat of the vehicle with passengers inside unless it's an emergency.
Since the vehicle is yours, you are permitted to access the back seat while carrying passengers.
Passengers cannot refuse you access to the backseat of your vehicle.
questions.answer: You must not enter the back seat of the vehicle with passengers inside unless it's an emergency.

questions.question: What information has the section about Driver Behaviour covered?
options: How TfL expects drivers to behave towards passengers and other road users
How TfL expects drivers to behave during Topographical assessments
How TfL expects operators to manage the drivers who work for them
questions.answer: How TfL expects drivers to behave towards passengers and other road users

questions.question: TfL takes sexual misconduct seriously. What happens if a driver acts in an unsuitable way toward a passenger?
options: TfL will not take this issue seriously
TfL or the police will fully investigate all complaints and reports, and they will take appropriate action.
Only the police will investigate all complaints and reports.
questions.answer: TfL or the police will fully investigate all complaints and reports, and they will take appropriate action.

questions.question: It is important that every time a passenger gets into a PHV they receive a high quality of service from their private hire driver.
options: all, quality, their
quality, Quality, their
their, Quality, there
questions.answer: all, quality, their

questions.question: Operators must report to the police any complaints that involve possible crimes so that they can be investigated.
options: must, crimes, investigated
going, criminal, investigation
have, crimes, investigating
questions.answer: must, crimes, investigated

questions.question: Although your operator will normally deal with complaints, passengers might contact the police or TfL directly.
options: your, complaints, directly
you, complaints, choice
their, concerns, telephone
questions.answer: your, complaints, directly

questions.question: If TfL does investigate a complaint that relates to you, we will provide you with the details of the complaint and ask for your comments.
options: does, provide, complaint
cold, sugar, communication
is, demand, query
questions.answer: does, provide, complaint

questions.question: As soon as you have had the opportunity to respond to the complaint and TfL has made any necessary enquiries, TfL will tell you the result of that investigation.
options: had, other, result
child, cut, test
done, review, outcome
questions.answer: had, other, result
